utterance.speaker: Originally aired
utterance.content: April 13, 2009

utterance.speaker: Man in Crowd
utterance.content: You made your point. Now how about letting us do our jobs?

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Our point will be made when your company stops tearing down this mountain.

utterance.speaker: Second Man
utterance.content: Then who’s gonna feed our kids? You?

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: If you really cared about your kids, you’d want them to have air to breathe when they grow up.

utterance.speaker: Second Man
utterance.content: What’d you say, you son of a bitch?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: You guys aren’t the problem. You’re being hurt more than anyone. You breathe in that coal dust.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Coal is the dirtiest energy on earth.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Gonna need some backup.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Not enough for you thugs to assault the environment?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Doug. Please, don’t.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Susan? Susan! You okay?

utterance.speaker: Policeman 2
utterance.content: She needs to get to a hospital.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: She’s just dehydrated. We have medics here. Let ‘em give her fluids.

utterance.speaker: Policeman 2
utterance.content: She has no pulse. Either unhook your arm, or I’m gonna break it off. Either way, this protest is over.

utterance.speaker: Man in Crowd
utterance.content: The protest is over now!

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Policeman 2
utterance.content: You passed out. It’s okay. Just dehydrated.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: ;You know we’ll be back. We’ll be back!

utterance.speaker: Policeman 2
utterance.content: Hey, stop screwing around.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: I’m not… screwing around. I just can’t… I can’t stand up.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I need to push back our getaway.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No you don’t. Found you a board. Perfect size to learn on.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m just postponing. O’Neill from Philly General wants me to get a patient in to see House.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I meant so, that’s five seconds to hand House the file, 30 for him to question your real motives, a minute for witty comments comparing the length of your legs to Thirteen’s… Plenty of time left over for the shore.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I need to make sure he doesn’t toss the file in the trash as soon as I’m out of sight.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Babe, can’t you repay the favor on another case? After last week, I could really use a break from this place. We both could.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Once I’m sure he’s really on the case, then we’re out of here. And these legs and every other part of me will be all yours.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s seen three different specialists.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting. Almost as interesting as you trying to step into Kutner’s shoes just days after he stepped out of them.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I am not shoe shopping. I’m just trying to repay a favor to his referring doctor.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What’s the mystery? The nutcase spends all his free time wreaking havoc at toxic waste dumps.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Tox screen’s negative. No neurological, muscular or cardiovascular abnormalities.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The guy cares about the environment. That makes him a nutcase?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He’s a single guy in his 20s. He cares about getting his hybrid waxed by girls who care about the environment.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: See? Not a nutcase.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He’s probably just faking so he can sue the cops and get a six-figure settlement.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: If he was trying to fake an illness, why would he consent to be seen by the best diagnostician in the country?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now who’s trying to get her hybrid waxed? We need to do a vestibular caloric test. See if the balance problem starts above or below the neck. And when I say “we,” I mean “you.” You’re the one with the favor to repay, not them.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m going to be injecting ice water in your ear canal. If the resulting eye movements are at all erratic, then the balance problem is in your inner ear.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Those in every room?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I think so.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Can you get rid of them? Preferably from every room. They use over 30 pesticides to grow commercial flowers. You’d think the medical industry would be a lot more —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Concerned with medicine? Let’s fix your body. Then you can go back to fixing the earth. This is gonna get a little uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: I just spent 14 hours chained to a tire.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Most doctors would recommend —

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Our planet’s headed for destruction. Coastlines under water. A million species extinct. Whoa. Feels like I’m tumbling head over heels.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That’s normal. Sometimes this test causes vertigo and nausea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cameron just brought me a case.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Cameron is happy in the ER. There’s no way she wants her nose back on your grindstone. Egg white omelet, no bacon, whole wheat toast.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I say it’s not my grindstone she’s after. And not her nose she wants on it. She and Chase are practically living together. What did you just order?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: An omelet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Since when do you pass on the swine? And wheat toast? Might as well eat a sheet of sandpaper.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes. But I don’t like eating the same thing two days in a row.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your bro’s nurse not lovin’ the love handles?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I’m just not in the mood for bacon. And you’re obviously trying to avoid talking about Kutner. Which is odd, because you spent a whole week obsessing about why —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s no longer on my team. I’m sorry he’s no longer on my team. Nothing else to talk about.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re wearing the watch he gave you for Secret Santa.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Five functions, including a stopwatch to time how long it takes you to ask me if I’m okay.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You gonna order?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not hungry.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It’s just weird. She’s brought cases before but he’s never made her run the tests.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Maybe he’s looking for someone to mother him after what happened.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The only kind of mothering House wants involves a bullwhip, leather diapers and a credit card.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Mommy’s home.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Test made the patient lose his lunch. But his calorics are normal. His inner ear is fine and he still can’t balance himself.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How many normal test results do we need to know the patient’s a granola-filled phony?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s not lying about his symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And you know this because —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She changed her shoes. If he was faking, he’d have vomited on the other side of the bed.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sparring with the police and chaining yourself up for days can cause stress. Stress screws with the heart and arteries. Carotid atherosclerosis could cause a loss of balance.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Wouldn’t show up on a CT or MRI.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Could also be our only warning before a massive stroke.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do a Holter and a carotid Doppler. See if his heart skips for more than the spotted owl. Although I didn’t say “we.” If I had… {Cameron leaves instead.]

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Sorry if this is screwing up the test. Been hiccupping a lot lately but… not as bad as this.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: How much is “a lot” and how long is “lately”?

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: It’s been on and off for about a week. Maybe a few hours a day.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Did you tell the doctors in Philly about it?

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: They didn’t seem to think it was any big deal.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hey, so we’re still leaving tomorrow, aren’t we?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m not sure. The referring doctors didn’t realize that his hiccups were —

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hiccups?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: With this duration and intensity, most likely pathological, and it could mean it’s serious.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Are you avoiding me?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So I shouldn’t be at all concerned that you’re treating another doctor’s patient for hiccups instead of going on a vacation I spent a week planning.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: There is a reason I need to stay with this case a while longer, but I can’t tell you what it is.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So you admit you lied to me. And now you’re asking me to trust you?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No sight of heart or arterial problems but he’s been hiccupping on and off for over a week.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice. I’m hooked. You can get back to your shift at the ER. Except, as far as the ER is concerned, you’re on vacation, right?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I postponed a trip because I’m concerned about the patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Explains why you ditched Chase and came to differentials, not why you ran the tests.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You told me to.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I’m not your boss, as you usually take great pleasure in pointing out. Hey, you don’t still have the hots for me, do you?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I care about the patient and I care about the people who work on your team. They’ve been through a lot lately. I just thought I —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was Florence Nightingale. Yeah. You’re gonna nurse us back to spiritual and mental oneness. That would make sense if we were having this conversation a week ago.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Think what you want — that I’m here to get a job, that I’m here to wrap you in swaddling clothes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The problem is, I think neither. Because neither makes sense. The only thing that does… doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Pathological hiccups plus inability to balance. Go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What she said.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Brain would connect the two.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It could, if Cameron hadn’t already CT’d his head. Empty as her boyfriend’s calendar.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What does this have to do with Chase?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not sure yet.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Patient is on a Jihad against commercial flowers. He’s picketed several nurseries. Organophosphate poisoning can cause both hiccups and —

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No GI problems. No hyper-salivation.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It’s possible it’s not connected to a protest. MS wouldn’t show on the CT and his name’s Swenson. Scandinavians have an increased susceptibility to MS.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Better theory than he’s faking it. The clogs have it. Do a lumbar puncture to confirm MS.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I guess we’ll just continue to twiddle our thumbs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: God, I hope that’s a euphemism.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: How am I supposed to do a lumbar puncture on a patient with intractable hiccups?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m trying to figure out what that could be a euphemism for. You’ll find a way.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You’re not worried House is gonna be pissed you’re helping me do the test?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He said find a way. And you did.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: How do you think House is doing?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That why you’re here?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No it isn’t. Even if House was messed up by Kutner’s suicide, it wouldn’t matter. He already thinks life is nasty, brutish and long. And misery helps his diagnostic skills. All of which you know so… Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Which answer would you believe?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you want Kutner’s place, it’s fine with me. I could use someone else with the stones to stand up to House. But you’ve gotta know it’s gonna blow up your relationship with Chase.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: All I did was postpone a three-day trip.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: With Chase. To be with House.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Ordering IV chlorpromazine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This could still be neurological. You could cloud his mental status.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You wanna get the needle in his spine or you wanna talk?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You and House been talking about filling Kutner’s slot?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yeah. We went straight from the funeral to Human Resources. You interested in getting back on the team?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’m interested in knowing if Cameron’s interested. She’s been running all the tests for House’s case.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, she hasn’t said anything to me. But I guess, uh, the referring doctor might have asked her to keep an eye on him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Do you think Cameron’s in love with House?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That is a ridiculous question. She’s in love with you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Are you in love with House?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That… is an even more ridiculous question.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Two questions. Zero answers. Think I can extrapolate from there.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: Dr. House?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, I’m just the Zone delivery guy.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: I’m, uh, Doug Swenson’s wife.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His history said the environmental kamikaze was single.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: He, um, he probably didn’t want me to worry. He told me he was in jail with some of the other protesters.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. No worries there.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: He’s in jail a lot. Not so often in the hospital. I searched his e-mail and I found the referral to you yesterday.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You must really love your husband and travel by rickshaw. It only took you 18 hours to get here. Who eats kale? It’s so bland it doesn’t even taste like kale.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: Uh, I had to find somebody to take care of our four-year-old son. Doug’s all right, isn’t he?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have no idea. I know he’s an idiot. And now I’ve learned that he’s a liar. So we’re making a — Who told you I was in here?

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: The doctor in the office next to yours said that you might be here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I got it figured out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That mean we don’t need to do the LP.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was talking to her. You’re not even supposed to be here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You want us to stop or not?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What? Oh, I don’t care what you do with him. You’re not doing a favor for a doctor in Philly. You’re doing a favor for an oncologist in North Jersey.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m spying on you for Wilson?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Spying, preemptive grief counseling.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Wilson sees you ten times more than I do. He’s a better liar and he wouldn’t have to cancel a vacation to do it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good points. Also doesn’t explain the diet.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: What does any of this have to do with my husband?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing. Meet Mrs. Environmental Nutbag. Or did you keep your maiden name?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s married?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yep. Got a kid too. Double threat. Eco-freak and deadbeat dad.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sorry… Parentally challenged.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, his neck.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It’s torticollis. Reaction to the chlorpromazine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s not just a spasm. It’s swollen. Crunchy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s definitely not MS. Crunching sounds were caused by an air leak between his lungs.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Leak in his mediastinum could have been caused by prolonged hiccups.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: More likely, it was the neck spasm.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Most likely, it was there all along. We just didn’t notice it till the other symptoms made it worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, what causes loss of balance, pathological hiccups, and a hole in his Gloria Steinem?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He was protesting a lumber mill last fall. Sarcoid’s been linked to pine forests.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. His A.C.E. levels were normal.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Progressive systemic sclerosis. Guy practically lives in industrial waste sites. If a solvent got absorbed through his lungs, caused an autoimmune firestorm…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Start him on IV methyl-prednisolone for systemic sclerosis. Do a full work-up to confirm.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: By myself?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Without yourself. Grab a bat. Grab some pine. Time to bring in the first string.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You obviously want to be here. I can’t figure out why. I wanna see where you go when you can’t be here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You know what vacation means, right?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You’re here because of House, Chase or overtime issues.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Well, if it’s all right with you, I’d rather communicate with Chase by communicating with Chase.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are you in love with House?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You… are not concerned about me. You’re marking your territory.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You shouldn’t be involved with House. Neither should I. Neither should anyone. You and Chase are good together. Just don’t screw it up.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: When are you gonna stop this?

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: How can you ask me to stop?

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: You’re in a hospital. You have a son.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The steroids ought to get him breathing normally again.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: But autoimmune diseases are serious. It might not be a bad idea to take some time at home. Rest up.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: I can’t just quit.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: Do you hate us that much?

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: I love you. And I love our son. But why should he matter more than everyone else’s?

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: He does.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Why? Because he’s biologically connected to me? There’s no rational reason.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: He’s our son!

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: And he’s gonna need to drink clean water. And breathe clean air. I’m doing this for him too.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Come on in, House. Because who else is it going to be at 10:30 at night? And, no thanks, I already ate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Didn’t ask you to dinner.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: But you were going to. And, when I explained that I’d eaten hours ago, you were going to move on to your real entrée, rifling through my kitchen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmmm. Inviting me to search your kitchen. Means that you know that I’d find nothing. Or that you know I’d find something so you’re hoping that I’m going to assume the former and I won’t bother to look.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Or it means it’s late, I’m tired, I know you’re here to advance some paranoid theory based on a single egg white omelet, and I’d like to get it over with so we can both go to sleep.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your single omelet theory conveniently overlooks the grassy knoll you had for lunch today. Vegetable and grain gag-athon.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The Warren Commission found no evidence of a second lunch. Possibly because it was stolen from the doctor’s lounge.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re not getting any fatter. Your medical records were clean.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You checked my — ?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re alone tonight, so it’s Kutner.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How could Kutner have any conceivable —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your patients live, your patients die. You float above it all like a medical colossus. But a fellow doctor dies…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That’s brilliant. Kutner was a wake-up call that if I didn’t eat healthier, I might kill myself.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mortality is mortality.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And… Ice cream is ice cream. Full fat content. Quadruple fat content.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Stuff you haven’t eaten just proves you haven’t eaten it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You were hoping for evidence of stuff I have eaten? First door on the right.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Excruciating pain in his left leg! Acute onset about ten minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: What are you doing to him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I assume they were checking for vascular pulsations. Either it’s negative or he’s a big wuss.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It’s not a tumor or an aneurism.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Metabolic bone disease?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Bone density’s normal.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But the bone covering might not be! If it’s osteomyelitis, an infection eating away at his periosteum —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That explains the pain. Odds are it’s a subclinical infection that we made worse with the steroids we gave him. Start him on IV antibiotics. X-ray his legs to confirm osteomyelitis.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Cameron’s already done a full set of lower-body x-rays.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The infection obviously flared. Do ‘em again.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Even if I had changed my diet, what possible reason could I have for hiding it from you?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Ankle, tibia, fibula all look normal. No inflammation, no signs of osteo.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Hang in there. We’re almost done.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You and your wife… You talk about stuff?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sex.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No. Anything else?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Money. I’m gonna go way out on a limb here. Foreman not a Chatty Cathy?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Normally, it doesn’t matter. But last week it did.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If you wanna date men, good chance talking won’t be — His femur’s fractured.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That’s impossible. It’s the hardest bone in the body.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And he broke it lying in bed.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How can you have a broken femur without so much as a bruise?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Whatever broke it had to do it from within.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Osteogenesis imperfecta?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Brittle bones wouldn’t cause hiccups. Plus, we’d have seen abnormal coloring in the sclerae.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which leaves cancer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Since when does bone cancer cause hiccups?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which means it’s not bone cancer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Or it’s not cancer.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: House is right. It’d be hard to find a guy outside Chernobyl who’d been exposed to more carcinogens. Pesticide plants, nuclear waste sites.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell Chase to repair the break. You two prep him for chemo.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You want to blast him with chemo for a cancer we don’t even know he has?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. I wanna blast him for with chemo for a cancer that explains the symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Intramedullary nail.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hold on.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That your House imitation? Some late-breaking epiphany

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I just want you to get a bone biopsy before you insert the pin.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: For a broken leg?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House is prepping him for chemo. Thought it might be worth checking for cancer before pumping him full of poison.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Does Cameron agree with House?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Cameron isn’t on the case anymore.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Still enjoying your day off, I see.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why are you prepping him for chemo?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The more interesting question is why do you care?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You’re not even sure that it’s —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What I mean is, why do you care from here? You can monitor the patient from home. What’s the difference between here and home?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You’re not at my home. This has nothing to do with —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Any other differences? Hmm… there’s less medical equipment, more training bras, and more Vegemite sandwiches. Actually, technically, right now, Chase is here. But that’s because I called him, and you didn’t know that. And it’s irrelevant to my point. Which is… You and Chase are over.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You are wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You decided that his single drawer of clothes is one drawer too many. But you don’t have the guts to tell him. So… You’re emotionally walking away instead of actually walking away. Which is stupid ‘cause only one of those is good for your heart.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s gonna ask me to marry him. I was looking for some thick socks. Found the ring.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you want to say no. So I circle right back to his single drawer of clothes —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I don’t want to say anything. I don’t want him to ask. Not now. Kutner… We’re all a little freaked out. We go home, we just wanna hug someone. We just wanna know everything’s gonna be okay. I don’t want him to propose just ‘cause he’s scared.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Husband
utterance.content: She’s got a headache, fever. She’s completely exhausted. Tell him about your chest, honey.

utterance.speaker: Wife
utterance.content: Um —

utterance.speaker: Husband
utterance.content: Her breasts are really tender.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You guys have a hot tub?

utterance.speaker: Husband
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She must go to the gym a lot.

utterance.speaker: Husband
utterance.content: Not in years.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then maybe when you travel on business you zip on down to that complimentary hotel spa.

utterance.speaker: Wife
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, did you just say yes?

utterance.speaker: Husband
utterance.content: What the hell’s wrong with her?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Got a minute?

utterance.speaker: Husband
utterance.content: He doesn’t. What’s wrong with her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry. I’m sure she’s got a medical crisis. And I need more time to figure out some leading questions for your wife.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What’s going on with Cameron?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She doesn’t want back on my team and she doesn’t want to jump me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wha, wha, wha, what? You ask a question. I rule out two possibilities and you’re satisfied? That means you don’t want an answer. You just wanted to know there wasn’t a particular answer. Either you were worried that she wanted back on my team, or you were worried that she wanted back on me.

utterance.speaker: Husband
utterance.content: This isn’t a medical crisis, is it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Could be. A lot of STDs hang in the balance. I give up. Vinegar compresses four times a day. Any chance I could just leave it at that? No. Pseudomonas folliculitis. It’s a skin infection from crowded and contaminated hot tubs, which you obviously use, but not with your husband. Tried to help a sister out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The nuclei were all normal. Bone cells were well differentiated. No dysplasia means no cancer.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: That’s good, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We hope so, although it also means we still have no idea what caused the break. How does it feel?

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: It hurts.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: Is it supposed to look like that?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. But it’s probably just residual bleeding from the surgery. We should be able to… I need two units of FFP, right away!

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: Oh my God! What’s happening?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He’s bleeding out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Means it’s gotta be cancer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s gotta be, except it’s not. The biopsy was negative.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Biopsies can be wrong. Symptoms can’t.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: All signs point to cancer but you can't blast a cancer you can’t find.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure you can. Prep him for total body irradiation.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You do realize that’s insane.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not unless you think the cancer’s cleverly hiding outside his body.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Steroids already weakened his immune system. That much radiation’ll kill him before it kills the cancer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And if he doesn’t have cancer, we could cause one or destroy his immune system altogether. The guy could die from an infected toenail.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’d rather do nothing, just let him die on his own?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I’d rather make his cancer worse.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That’s like pouring gasoline on a fire. At least total body irradiation’s an actual treatment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His idea is better. Pour away.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I lost my mojo.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Have you retraced your steps? Does your cleaning lady check your pockets before —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was clueless about Kutner. I was wrong about Cameron. Taub just came up with an idea that I should have seen long before he did.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No one saw anything coming with Kutner. You hardly ever see Cameron anymore. And you hired Taub to come up with ideas that you wouldn’t have come up with.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And I have no idea why you’re eating carrots.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m losing my mind. All you got to say is “good”?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, a guy you worked with for two years, who you mentored and, yes, possibly even cared about, just blew his brains out. You can’t find the reason, can’t find meaning in it because sometimes there isn’t any. Sometimes… this is all there is. You should be losing it. You’d be crazy not to be off your game. But your mojo is right where you left it. Just… keep playing with it. I gotta go. Help yourself.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I know this is a tough process. At the first sign of any tumors or masses, we can —

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: Start saying prayers?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It’s gonna be okay. Once we can —

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: No. It’s not gonna be okay. You’re growing his cancer.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: This isn’t the doctors’ fault. I’ve exposed myself to a lot of bad stuff. I knew the risks. I want my life to mean something. If that means I’m destined to…

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He’s in V-tach and no pulse. Grab the paddles!

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: Oh, God!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Charging. Clear! Charging. Clear!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’ve been looking for you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: And… I’ve been thinking about you. Just hadn’t reached the looking stage yet.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Which is the problem. You asked for a day. I gave you two. You told me you had a secret you couldn’t share. I respected that. Now I don’t know what’s worse — blowing off our vacation to hang around House or continuing to blow it off when he won’t hang around you?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: If you think I’m the least bit interested in House —

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don’t know what I’m supposed to think.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I know this looks bad. And —

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don’t care how it looks. I care what it is. And you’re not telling me what it is. I’m trying to trust you, but…

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I just… I need a little more time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: This… has nothing to do with House.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, well it has nothing to do with me, either. Not anymore. Let me know when I can come pick up my things.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Nothing on the echo. We drew a troponin level. No signs of myocardial ischemia. All the tests were normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Loss of balance. Pathological hiccups. Air leak between the lungs. Broken femur. Now tachycardia. Go! Come on, give me something. Give me a bad idea. Maybe I can turn it into a good one. Fine. Open him up and put in a defibrillator.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That’s permanent and risky. We don’t even know what, if anything, is wrong with his heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Redo all the tests. In the meantime, open him up, put in a defibrillator so he can live long enough for you to finish the tests.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Balance, organs, nerves, lungs, bones, heart.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Things you use to make bratwurst.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There’s no sign of infection. It’s not a metabolic or autoimmune disease. It’s definitely not cancer. I think.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Definitely not cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Aren’t you going to pick?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I’m thinking. Is there a ticking clock?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You already put your money in. You never do that until you decide.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That’s very observant of you. Too bad you distracted me. Now I’m… thinking I might change my mind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There’s nothing healthy in that machine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, there’s not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Gummi bears. You hate gummi bears.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: People can change.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. And more importantly, I hate them.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, fine. Then I won’t offer you any.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You manipulative bitch. You’re not suddenly eating healthy because you want to. You’re eating healthy because you know I don’t want to. I’ve been mooching food for ten years. Now, either it suddenly started bothering you this week or you’re —

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Screwing with you. It needed to be done. After Amber died, I withdrew, tried to change everything, hoping I’d sort it out. Find some deeper truth. It was a mistake. I should have gone back to normal, to here and now, because that’s all we can every really count on. Things need to get back to normal in your life. And… what could be more normal than me screwing with you and you figuring it out?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You manipulative bitch.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We need to put in a cardioverter-defibrillator. It’ll keep your heart beating while we keep looking.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It means, even if we figure this out, you’ll have to stop protesting anywhere not near a hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi! Got a few questions.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, we’re about to start doing —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A hopefully pointless medical procedure. Your life and my mojo hang in the balance. Pesticides are evil, which means that commercial flowers are doused in evil. But plant life is nature’s answer to evil. So you have a garden.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: No, we live in an apartment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A window box, then.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Potted plants?

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: Nothing. The commercial growers —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. They’re evil. Yeah, got it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House, I really don’t think we have time for this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your marriage sucks.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All marriages suck. Your marriage sucks.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: I love her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He loves a tree in Oregon more than he loves you. But he can’t have sex with it. Unless it’s that slutty oak outside Portland.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You wanna get to your point?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She’s had enough. She’s gonna leave. Or maybe she’s jut not putting out. Whatever. You gotta make it right, right away. You gotta compromise that precious flower principle.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: Never.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Once. Three weeks ago. Our anniversary. I missed the dinner to be at that rally. You planned it for months. You were mad. Really mad. I bought you flowers. I brought them home. You were gone. So was your suitcase. I tossed them and bought you the earrings.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Roses? Yes. You have sporotrichosis. It’s an infection from the thorn of the rose which, by any other name, is still a cheap marital aid.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: The flowers are what gave me —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lesion on your eighth cranial nerve knocks out your balance. Another on your phrenic nerve gives you serial hiccups. We then spread it to your bones and heart with steroids and insulin-like growth factor.

utterance.speaker: Franni
utterance.content: Please tell us that this is good news.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s good news for him. It’s good news for future generations. It’s crappy news for you. He’s gonna be fine. And he’ll never doubt himself again.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Damn. I was hoping I would interrupt something. Your favor’s repaid. Patient’s cured. He’s already packing for another Earth Day extravaganza next week.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He almost died. He can’t take a few days at home with his family?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: People only change after trauma if they wanted to change before the trauma. Or if they’ve watched too many afterschool specials.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You talking about Chase?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m talking about you. You lost husband number one. No surprise that the death of a colleague would make you question another long-term lease.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You teaching commitment classes? ‘Cause I thought you were too busy with your lecture on —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I told you I never wanted to dump Chase.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely. You want him to dump you. It’s totally different. Much less guilt. Either way, you’re out of reasons to avoid him. Kutner was a pretty dumb one to begin with.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I should never have postponed our vacation.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I should never have planned it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I found the ring in your sock. I didn’t want you to propose out of some sort of knee-jerk reaction to what happened to Kutner.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, I guess you don’t have to worry about that anymore.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m not. I… I don’t care how it happens. I just want it to happen.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Are… Are you proposing to me?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m... proposing that… you propose to me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: After I broke up with you. After you ruined my planned proposal, you expect me to —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m not expecting. Hoping.

utterance.speaker: Amber
utterance.content: Solved another case. Busted Wilson.
